title: What will happen to information technology in the next 10 years? - Quora

response.answer_text: The next 10 years will see a complete blending of a carriers network and the corporate network. That will create the need for some critical skill sets to manage the blending of networks. Here is what i am seeing right now …. The trends that I see with Office 365, One Cloud, Skype for Business and soon to be integrated LinkedIn will make Microsoft powerful for years. Companies like Salesforce.com, Oracle, Google and even Facebook are not going to sit still either! So … basically all the applications that everyone uses everyday have already begun the fast march to the cloud. The telecom carriers have a different march but equally transformative! They are virtualizing all their infrastructure. They core networks look closer to your IT closet than a carrier central office. In short order the virtualization of the carrier network and the rapid adoption of cloud based applications means that all this technology is going to morph into one big IT network with different levels of access, permissions and management. I think the jobs and the business opportunities is the need for security, user authentication and application management in a virtual software systems. You will have a safe career in technology if you focus on those three areas … SecurityIdentity and AuthenticationApplication Management.

Ten years ago, there were no smartphones. It was the coffee shop era of Wi-Fi, which meant that the Internet was just beginning to follow us out the door and into the world. Nowadays, of course, Wi-Fi and mobile data are almost global, smartphones have hit market saturation in the most developed nations, and EC2 is a cornerstone of modern business IT. The pace of technological progress continues to accelerate, it seems, as entire new product categories change the way we live and do business, and there’s no end in sight. Here’s our look ahead to 10 years in the future, and how the tech world may change: What we think of as productivity apps will change out of all recognitionThe ranks of the technology workforce will be more diverseCisco will stay on topCloud in 2026: The foundation of computingSmart apps reign in the Internet of ThingsHomomorphic encryption will keep data saferOpen-source will be, if possible, even more commonplaceIoT will finally hit its strideBig Data will play a Big Role on the network

One major forecast: Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) becomes a requirement for SaaS companies to implement. And those who do a good job of this will build incredibly powerful companies. From PaaS: Why I Am So Excited | Sramana Mitra Today, there are easily 200+ B-to-B SaaS companies out there, including 50+ public ones. The IPO market for cloud stocks is rich and we will see many others go public in due course. These are solid companies, nothing foo-foo about them. At least 10-20 of these are also exploring PaaS in a serious way. Some of these have particular focus on the startup ecosystem whereby entrepreneurs are building SaaS applications on their platforms and selling through their app marketplaces. If you’ve been reading my commentary on PaaS, you have already encountered several such players including Atlassian (NASDAQ: TEAM), Twilio (NYSE: TWLO) and Shopify (NYSE:SHOP), as well as Salesforce.com (NYSE: CRM), the market leader. There will always be a need for security, however the form that the job will take will likely evolve. With the advent of quantum computing, cryptography as we know it will become irrelevant, meaning new methods of securing data will need to be innovated by IT professionals and Mathematicians.
There will be more innovation and a huge demand for jack of all trades. General development and system administration jobs will be replaced by new tools. No easy entry for freshers.
